page.title: 19Horton Heath Methodist Ch.
page.content: and open for worship.The vestry, porch and any exteral buildings were added later.The pulpit came from the original Chapel and so did some of the pews. The trees and shrubs around the Chapel were given by members shortly after the Chapel was built.The members of the Chapel decided to stay independent of the coference, and is one of the very in the country to be in this position.The Chapel is entirely self-financing.Mr Morgan,a local farmer paid Lord Shaftesbury Â£50 for the land which had been leased,and gave to the trustees on condition that the deeds were never given to the conference.
